laboratory_examinations.findings: Hypoechoic mass in the distal esophagus (34 to 37 cm from the incisors) that extended to the muscularis propria and focally into the periesophageal fat (stage uT3); hypoechoic lymph node, 2.1 cm in diameter, in the gastrohepatic area.

laboratory_examinations.date: Approximately 6 days after upper gastrointestinal series
laboratory_examinations.findings: Thickening of the right anterolateral wall of the distal esophagus with enlarged 1.0 cm lymph node in the gastrohepatic ligament; suspicious for metastatic disease.
Intense area of increased uptake in the region of the distal esophagus and gastrohepatic ligament, suspicious for metastatic lymphadenopathy.
Decrease in mass size in the gastroesophageal junction and gastrohepatic node; marked decrease in 18F-FDG uptake in both areas.
laboratory_examinations.changes_over_time: Significant reduction in tumor sizes and metabolic activity compared with previous studies.
